dct_title_s: A New Mapp of AMERICA SEPTENTRIONALE
dct_description_sm: State 2, Variant: Undated and unchanged except for new dedication: To the Worshipful Jeffery Jefferys of the Priory in Brecknokshire. Coat of arms, pasted over the dedication to the Earl of Shaftesbury.
Wagner 400; Tooley 26 (Plate 40),27,28; Leighly 55; Mercator Society (Plate); UCB; Burden 397 (Plate 397).

Unchanged reissue of Sanson's 1650 "Amerique Septentrionale" as regards California, except that a tiny vignette of a deer is shown in the north of the island. Engraved by: Francis Lamb Sculp (lower left).
Designed by Mousieur [Nicolas] Sanson Geographer to the French King, and Rendred into English, and Illustrated by Richard Blome By his Majesties Especiall Command.
Issued in: Cosmography and Geography / R. Blome. -- London, 1693
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
